citations.narrative:
Multiple animals have not been vaccinated for Bordetella as scheduled in the program of veterinary care (PVC). There is
no record of Bordetella vaccination for 2 coydogs ("Yahoo" and "Toccoa") and 2 dogs ("Tater" and "Chappy"). One dog
"Todd" was last vaccinated for Bordetella on 04/17/2022 and not every 3 years after an initial series as scheduled in the
PVC. The animals appeared to be in good health during the inspection. Not vaccinating animals according to the PVC
schedule does not adequately protect animals from diseases as intended by the attending veterinarian. Licensees must
follow the written PVC for dogs which addresses the requirements for adequate veterinary care for contagious diseases
and sampling and treatment of parasites.
Correct by 08 October 2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
3.13(a) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
Multiple animals have not been vaccinated for Bordetella as scheduled in the program of veterinary care (PVC). There is 
no record of Bordetella vaccination for 2 coydogs ("Yahoo" and "Toccoa") and 2 dogs ("Tater" and "Chappy"). One dog 
"Todd" was last vaccinated for Bordetella on 04/17/2022 and not every 3 years after an initial series as scheduled in the 
PVC. The animals appeared to be in good health during the inspection. Not vaccinating animals according to the PVC 
schedule does not adequately protect animals from diseases as intended by the attending veterinarian. Licensees must 
follow the written PVC for dogs which addresses the requirements for adequate veterinary care for contagious diseases 
and sampling and treatment of parasites. 
 
Correct by 08 October 2025. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee. 
 
 n
